lusc.net.github

Class Defaults

  • java.lang.Object
    • lusc.net.github.Defaults

  • public class Defaults
extends java.lang.Object
    Defaults coordinates - across the whole of Luscinia - the writing and reading of default parameters for the UI to use. In general the rule here is that Defaults should only interact with UI classes, and in the future it may be moved to the ui package.
    Author:
    Rob

        public java.util.Properties props

    • Constructor Detail

      • Defaults

        public Defaults()
        constructor

    • Method Detail

      • readProperties

        public void readProperties()
        Reads all default properties from file into a new Properties object. Should be called once near the initiation of the program.

      • writeProperties

        public void writeProperties()
        Writes all the default values to file (lusciniaproperties). Should be called whenever a more permanent updating of default values is called for (especially on program shutdown, but also more frequently).

      • getIntProperty

        public int getIntProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Returns an integer value from the Properties store.
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        Returns:
        an integer default value.

      • getIntProperty

        public int getIntProperty(java.lang.String key,
                 int defval)
        Returns an integer value from the Properties store. If one is not found, returns a supplied default value instead
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        defval - the default value to return if nothing is found in the store
        Returns:
        an integer default value.

      • getDoubleProperty

        public double getDoubleProperty(java.lang.String key,
                       double multiplier)
        Returns a double value from the Properties store.
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        multiplier - (actually a divider). This allows double values to be stored as integers and must be specified.
        Returns:
        a double parameter, calculated as the value obtained from the store divided by multiplier

      • getDoubleProperty

        public double getDoubleProperty(java.lang.String key,
                       double multiplier,
                       double defval)
        Returns a double value from the Properties store. If one is not found, returns a supplied default value instead
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        multiplier - (actually a divider). This allows double values to be stored as integers and must be specified.
        defval - the default value to return if nothing is found in the store
        Returns:
        a double parameter, calculated as the value obtained from the store divided by multiplier

      • getStringList

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStringList(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a LinkedList of Strings from the properties store. Internally, '|~|' is used as a rather idiosyncratic separator between values.
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        Returns:
        a list of strings.

      • setStringList

        public void setStringList(java.lang.String key,
                 java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> ll)
        Adds/replaces a list of Strings to the store
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        ll - a LinkedList of Strings.

      • setIntProperty

        public void setIntProperty(java.lang.String key,
                  int x)
        Adds/replaces an integer to the store
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        x - an integer value to store

      • setDoubleProperty

        public void setDoubleProperty(java.lang.String key,
                     double x,
                     int multiplier)
        Adds/replaces a double to the store
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        x - a double value to store
        multiplier - a value to multiply x by, after which it is rounded to an integer before storage.

      • setBooleanArray

        public void setBooleanArray(java.lang.String key,
                   boolean[] data)
        Adds/replaces an array of booleans to the store. This is used for sets of radiobuttons, for example
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        data - an array of booleans to store.

      • getBooleanArray

        public boolean[] getBooleanArray(java.lang.String key,
                        int length)
        gets an array of booleans from the store.
        Parameters:
        key - the key value (String)
        length - the length of the array. I'm pretty sure this is superfluous!
        Returns:
        an array of booleans

      • setIndividualDetails

        public void setIndividualDetails(Individual ind)
        Convenience method that sets details of Individual objects to the defaults. This is used (with its get counterpart) for quickly filling in species, population details, for example.
        Parameters:
        ind - An Individual object

      • getIndividualDetails

        public void getIndividualDetails(Individual ind)
        Convenience method that gets details of Individual objects to the defaults. This is used for quickly filling in species, population details, for example. Ideally, this should probably call set methods in Individual.
        Parameters:
        ind - An Individual object

      • setSongDetails

        public void setSongDetails(Song song)
        Convenience method that sets details about Song objects. This is used with its get counterpart for quickly filling in recording details, for example.
        Parameters:
        song - A Song object

      • getSongDetails

        public void getSongDetails(Song song)
        Convenience method that gets details about Song objects. This is used for quickly filling in recording details, for example. This should probably use the set functions in Song.
        Parameters:
        song - A Song object

      • setSongParameters

        public void setSongParameters(Song song)
        Convenience method that gets spectrogram details about Song objects. This is used for defaul spectrogram parameters
        Parameters:
        song - A Song object.

      • getSongParameters

        public void getSongParameters(Song song)
        A convenience method that gets spectrogram parameters for a Song object. This should probably use the set functions in Song.
        Parameters:
        song - a Song object.

      • getMiscellaneousSongParameters

        public void getMiscellaneousSongParameters(Song song)
        A convenience function that gets a range of measurement parameters for a Song object. Is this necessary (or used)? Should it be rolled into the previous function?
        Parameters:
        song - A Song object

      • setStatisticsOutput

        public void setStatisticsOutput(boolean[] chooserV,
                       boolean[] chooserP,
                       boolean[] chooserM,
                       boolean[] chooserS,
                       boolean[] chooserSy)
        A convenience function to set the defaults for the statistics output. This method works in conjunction with StatisticsOutput.
        Parameters:
        chooserV - a boolean array for which element measures to set.
        chooserP - a boolean array for a range of metadata parameters.
        chooserM - a boolean array for which types of measures (mean, min, max etx) to set.
        chooserS - a boolean array for a range of scalar, typically temporal parameters.
        chooserSy - a boolean array for syllable parameters
